description:
Raised by Father Fujimoto, a famous exorcist, Rin Okumura never knew his real father. One day a fateful argument with Father Fujimoto forces Rin to face a terrible truth—the blood of the demon lord Satan runs in Rin's veins! Rin swears to defeat Satan, but doing that means entering the mysterious True Cross Academy and becoming an exorcist himself. Can Rin fight demons and keep his infernal bloodline a secret? It won't be easy, especially when drawing his father's sword releases the demonic power within him!

(Source: Viz Media)

Note: Includes 3 extra chapters.
synonyms: 青の祓魔師(エクソシスト)

tags.name: Demons
tags.description: Prominently features malevolent otherworldly creatures.

tags.name: Male Protagonist
tags.description: Main character is male.

tags.name: Shounen
tags.description: Target demographic is teenage and young adult males.

tags.name: Conspiracy
tags.description: Contains one or more factions controlling or attempting to control the world from the shadows.

tags.name: Urban Fantasy
tags.description: Set in a world similar to the real world, but with the existence of magic or other supernatural elements.

tags.name: Twins
tags.description: Prominently features two or more siblings that were born at one birth.

tags.name: Swordplay
tags.description: Prominently features the use of swords in combat.

tags.name: Primarily Teen Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of teen characters.

tags.name: Primarily Male Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of male characters.

tags.name: Exorcism
tags.description: Involving religious methods of vanquishing youkai, demons, or other supernatural entities.

tags.name: School
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a primary or secondary educational institution.

tags.name: Tragedy
tags.description: Centers around tragic events and unhappy endings.

tags.name: Orphan
tags.description: Prominently features a character that is an orphan.

tags.name: Religion
tags.description: Centers on the belief that humanity is related to supernatural, transcendental, and spiritual elements.

tags.name: Youkai
tags.description: Prominently features supernatural creatures from Japanese folklore.

tags.name: Clone
tags.description: Prominently features a character who is an artificial exact copy of another organism.

tags.name: Anthropomorphism
tags.description: Contains non-human character(s) that have attributes or characteristics of a human being.

tags.name: Gore
tags.description: Prominently features graphic bloodshed and violence.

tags.name: Body Horror
tags.description: Features characters who undergo horrific transformations or disfigurement, often to their own detriment.

tags.name: Chimera
tags.description: Features a beast made by combining animals, usually with humans.

tags.name: Espionage
tags.description: Prominently features characters infiltrating an organization in order to steal sensitive information.

tags.name: Curses
tags.description: Features a character, object or area that has been cursed, usually by a malevolent supernatural force.

tags.name: Magic
tags.description: Prominently features magical elements or the use of magic.

tags.name: Ensemble Cast
tags.description: Features a large cast of characters with (almost) equal screen time and importance to the plot.

tags.name: Mythology
tags.description: Prominently features mythological elements, especially those from religious or cultural tradition.

tags.name: Guns
tags.description: Prominently features the use of guns in combat.

tags.name: Kemonomimi
tags.description: Prominently features humanoid characters with animal ears.

tags.name: Time Manipulation
tags.description: Prominently features time-traveling or other time-warping phenomena.

tags.name: Heterosexual
tags.description: Prominently features a romance between a man and a woman, not inherently sexual.

tags.name: Kaiju
tags.description: Prominently features giant monsters.

tags.name: Memory Manipulation
tags.description: Prominently features a character(s) who has had their memories altered.

tags.name: Suicide
tags.description: The act or an instance of taking or attempting to take one's own life voluntarily and intentionally.

tags.name: Zombie
tags.description: Prominently features reanimated corpses which often prey on live humans and turn them into zombies.

tags.name: Nudity
tags.description: Features a character wearing no clothing or exposing intimate body parts.

node.description:
He was previously an assistant to [Tatsuki Fujimoto](https://anilist.co/staff/119917/Tatsuki-Fujimoto) and [Kazue Katou](https://anilist.co/staff/103052/Kazue-Katou)

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/_tatsuyaendo_)

Former assistant of the mangaka [Eiichirou Oda](https://anilist.co/staff/96881/Eiichirou-Oda), [Kouhei Horikoshi](https://anilist.co/staff/104834/Kouhei-Horikoshi), [Kouji Ooishi](https://anilist.co/staff/112651/Kouji-Ooishi), [Yoshikazu Amami](https://anilist.co/staff/137228/Yoshikazu-Amami), and [Kazue Katou](https://anilist.co/staff/103052/Kazue-Kato).

He is the son of the animator and animation director [Hiroki Shibata](https://anilist.co/staff/124452/Hiroki-Shibata). His younger sister [Hikari Shibata](https://anilist.co/staff/127324/Hikari-Shibata) is also a mangaka. He is married to the illustrator [OKADA](https://twitter.com/hoooojicha).

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/tokiwablue21)

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/marcbernabe) |  [Official Website](https://www.japonesenvinetas.com)

He is a translator and interpreter of Japanese, with special emphasis on the translation of manga and anime, a field in which he has a background of hundreds of volumes and episodes translated. In addition, he's a  specialist in didactics of the Japanese language and culture for Spanish speakers. He also has published many books about Japan and Asia.

He is famous for appearing in a Shin-chan's episode where the family goes to Spain.
Pierre Valls is Kaze Manga Edition Director since 2016.
